mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Philcade Building is significant in Tulsa for its interior art work, architectural design, and association with the oil industry. Waite Phillips, the buildingâ€™s first owner and builder, played a very important role in the history of Oklahoma oil. The building served as headquarters for many developing oil companies and individuals connected with the oil industry. Many of these companies and their descendants are still active in the Oklahoma oil industry today. The Philcade Building was listed in the National Register on September 18, 1986. -- http://www.tulsapreservationcommission.org/artdeco/buildings/index.pl?id=34 [work]
